messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 63 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Cross-platform programming model for many-core lattice Boltzmann simulation

Paper Abstract: Abstract We present a novel, hardware-agnostic implementation strategy for lattice Boltzmann (LB) simulations, which yields massive performance on homogeneous and heterogeneous many-core platforms. Based solely on C++17 Parallel Algorithms, our approach does not rely on any language extensions, external libraries, vendor-specific code annotations, or pre-compilation steps. Thanks in particular to a recently proposed GPU back-end to C++17 Parallel Algorithms, it is shown that a single code can compile and reach state-of-the-art performance on both many-core CPU and GPU environments for the solution of a given non trivial fluid dynamics problem. The proposed strategy is tested with six different, commonly used implementation schemes to test the performance impact of memory access patterns on different platforms. Nine different LB collision models are included in the tests and exhibit good performance, demonstrating the versatility of our parallel approach. This work shows that it is less than ever necessary to draw a distinction between research and production software, as a concise and generic LB implementation yields performances comparable to those achievable in a hardware specific programming language. The results also highlight the gains of performance achieved by modern many-core CPUs and their apparent capability to narrow the gap with the traditionally massively faster GPU platforms. All code is made available to the community in form of the open-source project stlbm, which serves both as a stand-alone simulation software and as a collection of reusable patterns for the acceleration of pre-existing LB codes.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 63 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 63"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Palabos: Parallel Lattice Boltzmann Solver",
        "Numerical simulations of particulate suspensions via a discretized Boltzmann equation. Part 1. Theoretical foundation",
        "The Lattice Boltzmann Method: Principles and Practice",
        "Enhanced single-node boundary condition for the Lattice Boltzmann Method",
        "An efficient kernel-based implementation of POSIX threads",
        "Parallel programming models for heterogeneous many-cores: a comprehensive survey",
        "PACXX: Towards a Unified Programming Model for Programming Accelerators Using C++14",
        "Thrust: A productivity-oriented library for CUDA",
        "Multicore Desktop Programming with Intel Threading Building Blocks",
        "Optimization and profiling of the cache performance of parallel lattice Boltzmann codes",
        "waLBerla: A block-structured high-performance framework for multiphysics simulations",
        "An efficient swap algorithm for the lattice Boltzmann method",
        "Accelerating Lattice Boltzmann Fluid Flow Simulations Using Graphics Processors",
        "Auto-vectorization friendly parallel lattice Boltzmann streaming scheme for direct addressing",
        "Optimization principles and application performance evaluation of a multithreaded GPU using CUDA",
        "Implementation of a Lattice Boltzmann kernel using the Compute Unified Device Architecture developed by nVIDIA",
        "LBM based flow simulation using GPU computing processor",
        "A new approach to the lattice Boltzmann method for graphics processing units",
        "Memory transfer optimization for a lattice Boltzmann solver on Kepler architecture nVidia GPUs",
        "Performance Optimization of 3D Lattice Boltzmann Flow Solver on a GPU",
        "Evaluation of a performance portable lattice Boltzmann code using OpenCL",
        "Performance Evaluation of an OpenCL Implementation of the Lattice Boltzmann Method on the Intel Xeon Phi",
        "Sailfish: A flexible multi-GPU implementation of the lattice Boltzmann method",
        "Advances in multi-domain lattice Boltzmann grid refinement",
        "Analysis and reduction of spurious noise generated at grid refinement interfaces with the lattice Boltzmann method",
        "The Lattice Boltzmann Equation for Fluid Dynamics and Beyond",
        "Cellular Automata Modeling of Physical Systems",
        "Two-relaxation-time Lattice Boltzmann Scheme: About Parametrization, Velocity, Pressure and Mixed Boundary Conditions",
        "Initial and boundary conditions for the lattice Boltzmann method",
        "Comprehensive comparison of collision models in the lattice Boltzmann framework: Theoretical investigations",
        "Impact of collision models on the physical properties and the stability of lattice Boltzmann methods",
        "Lattice BGK Models for Navier-Stokes Equation",
        "Multiphysics flow simulations using D3Q19 lattice Boltzmann methods based on central moments",
        "Viscosity independent numerical errors for Lattice Boltzmann models: From recurrence equations to “magic” collision numbers",
        "Generalized lattice-Boltzmann equations",
        "Theory of the lattice Boltzmann method: Dispersion, dissipation, isotropy, Galilean invariance, and stability",
        "Multiple-relaxation-time lattice Boltzmann models in three dimensions",
        "Lattice Boltzmann Method with Regularized Pre-collision Distribution Functions",
        "A general multiple-relaxation-time Boltzmann collision model",
        "Duality in matrix lattice Boltzmann models",
        "Recovery of Galilean invariance in thermal lattice Boltzmann models for arbitrary Prandtl number",
        "Cascaded digital lattice Boltzmann automata for high Reynolds number flow",
        "Aerodynamic Simulations of a High-Lift configuration by Lattice Boltzmann Method with Block-Structured Cartesian Grid",
        "Simulations of Aerodynamic Separated Flows Using the Lattice Boltzmann Solver XFlow",
        "High-order regularization in lattice-Boltzmann equations",
        "Central-moment-based Galilean-invariant multiple-relaxation-time collision model",
        "Compressibility in lattice Boltzmann on standard stencils: effects of deviation from reference temperature",
        "The cumulant lattice Boltzmann equation in three dimensions: Theory and validation",
        "Scrutinizing lattice Boltzmann methods for direct numerical simulations of turbulent channel flows",
        "A filtered cumulant lattice Boltzmann method for violent two-phase flows",
        "Implicit Large-Eddy Simulation of rotating and non-rotating machinery with Cumulant Lattice Boltzmann method aiming for industrial applications",
        "Increasing stability and accuracy of the lattice Boltzmann scheme: Recursivity and regularization",
        "Recursive regularization step for high-order lattice Boltzmann methods",
        "Hermite regularization of the lattice Boltzmann method for open source computational aeroacoustics",
        "A new hybrid recursive regularised Bhatnagar-Gross-Krook collision model for Lattice Boltzmann method-based Large Eddy Simulation",
        "Linear stability of athermal regularized lattice Boltzmann methods",
        "Universal formulation of central-moments-based lattice Boltzmann method with external forcing for the simulation of multiphysics phenomena",
        "Three-dimensional cascaded lattice Boltzmann method: Improved implementation and consistent forcing scheme",
        "High-Reynolds-number turbulent cavity flow using the lattice Boltzmann method",
        "Reynolds number and end-wall effects on a lid-driven cavity flow",
        "Accurate three-dimensional lid-driven cavity flow",
        "Summary of the LAGOON solutions from the Benchmark problems for Airframe Noise Computations-III Workshop",
        "Efficient LBM on GPUs for dense moving objects using immersed boundary condition"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 63 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Cross-platform programming model for many-core lattice Boltzmann simulation, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
